jobs.title: Account Executive
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the Role

As our first Account Executive, you'll own the full sales cycle and help build our go-to-market foundation. You'll be responsible for driving new business across multiple customer segments, building strategic relationships, and contributing to our overall sales strategy and processes. This role requires an entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to operate independently, build relationships, and thrive in a fast-paced environment where you'll have a significant impact on company growth and revenue.

What you'll do

  • Own the complete sales cycle from prospecting to close, focusing on new business acquisition and quota attainment

  • Build and maintain a robust pipeline based on strong inbound interest for our product

  • Conduct outbound prospecting and cultivate strong relationships with startups and enterprises using our self serve platform supporting them to scale usage across their organization

  • Deliver compelling technical demonstrations and presentations to prospects ranging from individual developers, founders and C-suite executives

  • Take a consultative approach to understand customer needs, identify pain points, and tailor solutions that demonstrate measurable business impact

  • Gather competitive intelligence and enterprise customer requirements to inform product development and go-to-market strategy

  • Develop relationships with key ecosystem partners, industry organizations, and channels to create systematic access to qualified prospects

  • Contribute to building repeatable sales processes, playbooks, and best practices as we scale the sales organization

  • Work closely with marketing, product, engineering and customer success teams to optimize the customer journey and drive growth

About You

  • 5+ years of proven B2B sales success with demonstrated ability to meet/exceed quotas in a consultative selling environment

  • Track record closing $100K+ annual contracts and navigating complex, multi-stakeholder sales processes

  • Experience thriving in an early-stage company environment where you've built processes, adapted quickly, and operated with limited resources

  • Ability to understand and communicate complex technical products to both technical and business audiences

  • Deep understanding of AI/ML landscape, including large language models, API architectures, and developer integration patterns commonly used in AI applications.

  • Exceptional presentation and communication abilities across all organizational levels

  • Proficiency with CRM platforms and sales engagement tools

  • Entrepreneurial mindset with ability to work independently, prioritize effectively, and drive results with minimal oversight

Bonus Points

  • Experience selling developer tools, AI/ML infrastructure, or API-first products

  • Previous experience as a first sales hire or early sales team member

  • Track record of building sales processes from the ground up

  • Familiarity with PLG (Product-Led Growth) motions and technical evaluation processes

jobs.title: Senior Full-Stack Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the Role:

OpenRouter is the world’s largest marketplace of LLMs, growing rapidly to meet the evolving needs of developers, enterprises, and AI enthusiasts. As part of our small, highly technical team of 10, we are looking for a Senior Full-Stack Engineer who thrives on shipping user-facing features, building elegant front-end interfaces with React, and creating powerful backend API functionality.

This role is ideal for engineers who love autonomy, value collaboration, and have a track record of shipping software that works. You’ll play a critical role in shaping our product as we scale, helping expand our platform’s features, and delivering exceptional experiences for our users.

We work asynchronously over Slack, Notion, and Linear, protecting uninterrupted time to build. If you’re passionate about crafting high-quality software, working with cutting-edge technology, and helping us create an impactful AI infrastructure company, we’d love to hear from you.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Front-End Development:
    Build and maintain user-friendly, high-performance interfaces using React and Next.js. Translate designs into smooth, functional experiences for our diverse user base.

  • API Development & Backend Work:
    Design, implement, and deploy scalable API functionality using Cloudflare Workers and edge-first architectures. Ensure robust backend systems to support our platform's rapid growth.

  • End-to-End Product Ownership:
    Take features from concept to production, ensuring they are performant, reliable, and delightful for users. Make good product and design decisions, and be open to feedback and collaborative creation.

  • Maintain High Standards:
    Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented TypeScript code. We believe in good types! Contribute to code reviews, bring your experience, and uphold best practices to elevate the team.

  • Problem Solving & Scalability:
    Identify bottlenecks, build great monitoring, propose solutions, and optimize performance across both frontend and backend systems.

About You:

  • Experience:
    4+ years of professional experience in full-stack development, including shipping user-facing features and working with modern front-end frameworks.

  • Technical Expertise:
    Proficient in React, TypeScript, Next.js, and JS runtimes. Bonus points for experience with Cloudflare Workers or other edge-first serverless platforms.

  • Startup Mindset:
    You thrive in fast-paced, ambiguous environments. You're resourceful, proactive, and comfortable taking ownership of projects end-to-end.

  • Collaborative & Autonomous:
    Strong communication skills and a team-oriented attitude. You can self-manage and deliver high-quality results while working asynchronously.

  • Craftsperson's Approach:
    You care deeply about user experience, performance, and maintainability. Your goal is to ship delightful and impactful features, not just code.

What We Offer:

  • Cutting-Edge Work:
    Be at the forefront of AI and LLM infrastructure, building tools for developers and enterprises alike.

  • Small, Talented Team:
    Work closely with a tight-knit group of top-notch engineers who value excellence and innovation.

  • Growth Opportunities:
    As we scale, grow into leadership roles or specialize further in your area of interest.

  • Competitive Compensation:
    Attractive salary, equity, and benefits that reflect the impact you’ll have on our success.

jobs.title: Product Designer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the Role:

OpenRouter is building the world’s largest marketplace for LLMs, growing rapidly to meet the evolving needs of developers, enterprises, and AI enthusiasts. As our first designer, you'll join a small, highly technical team of 7.

This role is perfect for someone who is highly productive, has high agency, and is excited to own the entire design function, from UI/UX to product thinking, and enjoys working closely with founders and engineers. You’ll play a critical role in shaping our platform, building out our design system from scratch, and solving problems for our customers.

While we're not expecting you to directly implement designs in code, we are looking for someone who is excited to embrace modern AI tools that begin to move design closer to the code. Since we’re building a technical AI infrastructure product, the ideal candidate is someone who is excited about AI software and services and is excited to dig in and understand the value proposition of OpenRouter.

Key Responsibilities:

UI/UX & Design System:

  • Own the end-to-end design process: research, wireframing, prototyping, and final implementation.

  • Build and maintain a scalable design system, while still being focused on shipping.

  • Collaborate closely with engineering to ensure designs translate well into code.

  • Optimize usability and simplify complex AI workflows to create intuitive, developer-friendly experiences.

Product & Strategy:

  • Work directly with founders to refine product vision, user experience, and design priorities.

  • Contribute to product strategy by aligning business goals, user needs, and technical constraints.

  • Listen to our customers and iterate based on feedback.

Collaboration & Execution:

  • Partner with engineers to ship fast, functional, and delightful user experiences.

  • Use AI-powered design tools to move faster, automate repetitive tasks, and generate creative solutions.

  • Participate in product and design critiques, working asynchronously with the team over Slack, Notion, and Linear.

About You:

  • 5+ years of experience in Product Design, UI/UX, or a related field.

  • Strong background in end-to-end product design, from UX research to high-fidelity UI.

  • Fluent in TailwindCSS or comfortable working closely with utility-first design systems.

  • Excited about AI—you don’t need to be an ML expert, but you should be eager to design for technical users.

  • A startup mindset—you thrive in ambiguity, take ownership, and can move quickly with limited resources.

  • Strong communication skills—you know how to articulate design rationale and work effectively in a remote, async team.

What We Offer:

  • High-impact role: Shape the design language and UX of a rapidly growing AI infrastructure company.

  • Fast-moving, technical team: Work with experienced engineers and founders who prioritize execution.

  • Ownership & autonomy: You’ll own the design function and have the freedom to drive it as you see fit.

  • Competitive compensation: Salary + meaningful equity in an early-stage, high-growth startup.

If you’re a highly capable, product-minded designer who loves working close to the code, we’d love to hear from you.

WHAT WE OFFER:

 - High-impact role: Shape the design language and UX of a rapidly growing AI infrastructure company.

 - Fast-moving, technical team: Work with experienced engineers and founders who prioritize execution.

 - Ownership & autonomy: You’ll own the design function and have the freedom to drive it as you see fit.

 - Competitive compensation: Salary + meaningful equity in an early-stage, high-growth startup.

If you’re a highly capable, product-minded designer who loves working close to the code, we’d love to hear from you.

jobs.title: Product Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About OpenRouter

OpenRouter operates the largest marketplace and routing layer for large-language models: 400+ models from 60+ providers are reachable through a single API, contract, and bill, eliminating infrastructure sprawl for developers and enterprises alike. We make AI “just work” so companies can focus on what they do best.

We believe LLMs will be the largest software market ever, and today we’re the largest aggregator and discovery point. We serve more than a million developers and route over $100m in annualized inference spend, backed by a16z and Menlo Ventures. We are a fully-remote team of roughly 15 people.

Our culture is engineering-first and velocity-obsessed; we prize clarity, autonomy, and rapid iteration.

The Role

This is our first dedicated Product Management hire. You will become the connective tissue between our engineering and a fast-growing, increasingly up-market customer base of companies that rely on OpenRouter for their inference. You’ll own the backlog end-to-end (triaging issues, framing trade-offs, sequencing work to ship) and create lightweight processes that keep the team organized and focused, and evolve those processes flexibly as we grow. You’ll collaborate directly with the founders on product strategy, roll up your sleeves to write crisp PRDs, interview users, and validate that what we build drives results.

What You’ll Do

Execution & Delivery: Run sprint planning / backlog grooming in Linear (or something better). Create clear specs for both in-depth AI APIs (in collaboration with engineering), and customer-facing web application work. Define success metrics and release criteria; close the loop post-launch with monitoring and retros.

Discovery & Insight: Get on calls with both developer and enterprise buyers; synthesize findings into opportunities and PRDs. Try out the competition, keep on top of the latest trends, and help us decide where we head next.

Prioritization & Strategy: Maintain a living product roadmap that links initiatives to company-level goals and OKRs. Size, rank, and prioritize the opportunities in front of us, while balancing product-led-growth initiatives and the needs of enterprise customers.

About You

  • 3-6 years of product management experience shipping consumer, technical SaaS, or developer-first software products.

  • Comfortable reading API docs, discussing latency, rate-limits, and tokenization trade-offs with engineers.

  • Demonstrated strength in backlog hygiene, prioritization frameworks, and turning ambiguity into action.

  • Skilled at customer discovery; can run a great interview and distill insights into crisp problem statements.

  • Startup mindset: high agency, bias for action, ok with “good process, light bureaucracy.”

  • Excellent written communication; you default to over-communicating in remote, async environments.

Bonus Points

  • Prior work on AI/ML infrastructure, cloud platforms, or marketplaces.

  • Familiarity with analytics tools (e.g., PostHog, Mixpanel) and basic SQL for self-service data pulls.

  • Experience with developer-first or PLG GTM motions.

What We Offer

  • High impact & autonomy: Shape the roadmap of a business at the center of the AI tooling ecosystem.

  • Technical, fast team: Work alongside world-class engineers who value shipping over ceremony.

  • Competitive comp & meaningful equity in a venture-backed, high-growth company.

  • Fully remote, plus regular on-sites for strategy and team-building.

jobs.title: Director, Ecosystem Partnerships
jobs.descriptionHtml:
As Director of Partnerships, you'll lead the development and execution of OpenRouter's comprehensive partner strategy to accelerate AI adoption and revenue growth. You'll build and scale a vibrant partner ecosystem that includes product, distribution and ISV partnerships aimed at growing our user base and revenue.

You'll be the first partnerships hire, responsible for creating our partnerships strategy, managing relationships with our most strategic partners, and setting partner-influenced revenue targets. You'll work cross-functionally with product, engineering, sales, and marketing to position OpenRouter as the platform of choice for AI-native applications.

What You'll Do:

  • Build strategic platform and product partnerships with complementary AI/ML companies to drive technical integrations, expand distribution, and accelerate mutual customer adoption.

  • Drive partnership revenue and growth targets by tracking partner contribution to customer acquisition, product usage, and expansion across the full partnership lifecycle.

  • Analyze the AI/ML ecosystem to identify priority partners, competitive dynamics, and emerging opportunities while maintaining expertise in AI infrastructure and partnership trends.

  • Navigate multi-sided platform dynamics by coordinating across internal teams, technology partners, and customers to structure agreements that create mutual value.

  • Negotiate complex partnership agreements, including technical integrations, data privacy terms, GTM commitments, and commercial structure, while building scalable onboarding frameworks.

  • Collaborate cross-functionally with Product, Engineering, Sales, Marketing, and Legal to prioritize partner integrations, develop co-marketing initiatives, and balance partner needs with product strategy.

Required:

  • 8+ years in partnerships, business development, or strategic alliances, with at least 3-5 years in a leadership role building partnership programs from scratch.

  • Experience managing strategic partnerships with leading technology providers (e.g., AI model providers, API platforms, SaaS companies), including developing technical integrations, API distribution strategies, and product-led growth (PLG) or sales-led growth (SLG) initiatives.

  • Proven track record scaling consumption-based or usage-based partnership models (API platforms, developer tools, infrastructure) with measurable impact on product adoption and revenue ($10M+ in influenced consumption/revenue).

  • Strong commercial and legal acumen with experience negotiating complex agreements involving data governance, SLAs, consumption economics, and technical integration commitments.

  • Technical background or deep fluency with API platforms, developer tooling, and cloud infrastructure—able to engage credibly with engineering teams on integration architecture, authentication patterns, and data flows.

  • Strategic thinker who can balance long-term ecosystem building with short-term execution, comfortable with ambiguity and building from zero to one.

jobs.title: Senior Data Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
OpenRouter operates the largest marketplace and routing layer for large-language models: 400+ models from 60+ providers are reachable through a single API, contract, and bill, eliminating infrastructure sprawl for developers and enterprises alike. We make AI “just work” so companies can focus on what they do best.

We believe LLMs will be the largest software market ever, and today we’re the largest aggregator and discovery point. We serve more than a million developers and route over $100m in annualized inference spend, backed by a16z and Menlo Ventures. We are a fully-remote team of roughly 15 people.

Our culture is engineering-first and velocity-obsessed; we prize clarity, autonomy, and rapid iteration.

About the Role:
We’re hiring our first Senior Data Engineer to architect, build, and own our end-to-end data platform. Our position in the AI marketplace gives us uniquely rich usage and performance data; your job is to turn that data into reliable and scalable datasets and products that deliver clear value to customers while informing our own product decisions. You’ll stand up our data warehousing and pipelines from scratch, connect product and platform data, and make high-leverage data accessible and trustworthy to our customers and across the company.

Key Responsibilities:
Data Platform & Warehousing: Stand up central analytics store. Define schemas, partitioning, retention, and performance strategies for scale. Establish data contracts and documentation to keep data consistent and discoverable.

ETL/ELT Pipelines & Orchestration: Build, operate, and monitor robust ETL/ELT pipelines. Implement CDC and batch/stream ingestion patterns; ensure idempotency, safe backfills, and predictable reprocessing.

Customer Data Products: Design and ship the data foundations for customer-facing metrics (latency, throughput, error rates, reliability/SLOs, cost), with strong handling of late/duplicate events. Build secure, multi-tenant datasets and APIs for customers; enforce isolation with row/column-level security, access controls, and privacy guardrails.

End-to-End Ownership: Take data features from concept to production: design, implement, backfill/migrate, document, and support.

About You:

  • 4+ years as a Data Engineer (or similar), including owning production pipelines and a modern data warehouse (Clickhouse, Snowflake, Databricks, etc)

  • Expert SQL and Python with deep experience with ETL/ELT design, data modeling, and performance tuning.

  • Experience building end-to-end data infrastructure: storage, compute, networking, orchestration, CI/CD for data, monitoring/alerting, and cost management.

  • Excellent communicator who can self-manage, set expectations, and partner across functions while working asynchronously.

  • You’re customer-obsessed and product-minded, starting from the user problem and shipping pragmatically to deliver value fast.

  • Biased to action, comfortable with ambiguity, and able to prioritize for impact. You default to simple, reliable solutions and iterate quickly.

Bonus Points

  • Experience as the first/early data hire building 0 to 1

  • Direct experience with Clickhouse, Postgres, GCP, or Terraform

  • Experience standing up event streaming platforms (e.g. Kafka, Pub/Sub)

  • Experience with database privacy/compliance standards (e.g., SOC 2, GDPR/CCPA)

What We Offer:

  • Cutting-Edge Work:

    • Be at the forefront of AI and LLM infrastructure, building tools for developers and enterprises alike.

  • Small, Talented Team:

    • Work closely with a tight-knit group of top-notch engineers who value excellence and innovation.

  • Growth Opportunities:

    • As we scale, grow into leadership roles or specialize further in your area of interest.

  • Competitive Compensation:

    • Attractive salary, equity, and benefits that reflect the impact you’ll have on our success.

About the Role:
We’re hiring our first Senior Data Engineer to architect, build, and own our end-to-end data platform. Our position in the AI marketplace gives us uniquely rich usage and performance data; your job is to turn that data into reliable and scalable datasets and products that deliver clear value to customers while informing our own product decisions. You’ll stand up our data warehousing and pipelines from scratch, connect product and platform data, and make high-leverage data accessible and trustworthy to our customers and across the company.

Key Responsibilities:
Data Platform & Warehousing: Stand up central analytics store. Define schemas, partitioning, retention, and performance strategies for scale. Establish data contracts and documentation to keep data consistent and discoverable.

ETL/ELT Pipelines & Orchestration: Build, operate, and monitor robust ETL/ELT pipelines. Implement CDC and batch/stream ingestion patterns; ensure idempotency, safe backfills, and predictable reprocessing.

Customer Data Products: Design and ship the data foundations for customer-facing metrics (latency, throughput, error rates, reliability/SLOs, cost), with strong handling of late/duplicate events. Build secure, multi-tenant datasets and APIs for customers; enforce isolation with row/column-level security, access controls, and privacy guardrails.

End-to-End Ownership: Take data features from concept to production: design, implement, backfill/migrate, document, and support.

About You:

 - 4+ years as a Data Engineer (or similar), including owning production pipelines and a modern data warehouse (Clickhouse, Snowflake, Databricks, etc)

 - Expert SQL and Python with deep experience with ETL/ELT design, data modeling, and performance tuning.

 - Experience building end-to-end data infrastructure: storage, compute, networking, orchestration, CI/CD for data, monitoring/alerting, and cost management.

 - Excellent communicator who can self-manage, set expectations, and partner across functions while working asynchronously.

 - You’re customer-obsessed and product-minded, starting from the user problem and shipping pragmatically to deliver value fast.

 - Biased to action, comfortable with ambiguity, and able to prioritize for impact. You default to simple, reliable solutions and iterate quickly.

Bonus Points

 - Experience as the first/early data hire building 0 to 1

 - Direct experience with Clickhouse, Postgres, GCP, or Terraform

 - Experience standing up event streaming platforms (e.g. Kafka, Pub/Sub)

 - Experience with database privacy/compliance standards (e.g., SOC 2, GDPR/CCPA)

What We Offer:

 - Cutting-Edge Work:
   
   - Be at the forefront of AI and LLM infrastructure, building tools for developers and enterprises alike.

 - Small, Talented Team:
   
   - Work closely with a tight-knit group of top-notch engineers who value excellence and innovation.

 - Growth Opportunities:
   
   - As we scale, grow into leadership roles or specialize further in your area of interest.

 - Competitive Compensation:
   
   - Attractive salary, equity, and benefits that reflect the impact you’ll have on our success.

jobs.title: Sales Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
As a Sales Engineer, you'll be the technical quarterback for OpenRouter's enterprise sales cycles. You'll partner with account executives to conduct discovery, deliver compelling demos, architect solutions, and overcome technical objections. You'll be the trusted technical advisor who helps prospects understand how OpenRouter solves their specific AI challenges.

This role sits at the intersection of sales, engineering, and product—you'll need to be equally comfortable in customer meetings, building demo environments, and providing product feedback to engineering.

What You'll Do

  • Lead technical discovery calls to understand the prospect's AI/ML architecture, use cases, and requirements.

  • Develop expertise in OpenRouter’s products and solutions, and how they can be leveraged to solve business problems.

  • Assess technical fit, including API integration, model requirements, data residency needs, and compliance requirements.

  • Design and deliver customized product demonstrations showcasing OpenRouter's capabilities for prospects’ specific use cases.

  • Create demos to showcase OpenRouter and manage proof-of-concept environments.

  • Partner with AEs throughout the sales cycle from discovery through close. Respond to proposals and technical questions from customers. Present at customer meetings, QBRs, and executive briefings.

  • Address technical objections and competitive positioning and support contract negotiations on technical terms, SLAs, and implementation timelines.

  • Provide feedback to the Product and Engineering teams on feature requests, competitive gaps, and market requirements. Contribute to product roadmap prioritization based on customer needs.

  • Stay current on AI/ML trends and competitive landscape.

What You Bring

  • 5+ years as Sales Engineer, Solutions Engineer, or Solutions Architect in B2B SaaS/API/Infrastructure platforms.

  • Strong technical background with hands-on experience in software development, APIs, or cloud infrastructure.

  • Excellent presentation skills with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to varied audiences. Strong problem-solving skills and ability to architect solutions under pressure.

  • Customer-first mindset with genuine desire to help customers succeed.

  • Experience in a sales engineering role related to AI/ML technologies, LLMs, or machine learning platforms is a plus.
